name: Curvenote
headline: Communication and publishing tools for scientists
description: At Curvenote we are building the communication and publishing tools for scientists and engineers. In the future, every scientific report will feature interactive graphs with live data that will make it significantly easier to share and reproduce the work.

founders.name: Rowan Cockett, Founder
founders.description:
I started and sold my previous web-based 3d visualization startup while I was finishing my PhD in computational geophysics. I then ran the cloud team at Seequent ($1.05B exit, 2021).

I am interested in the intersection of education, industry, and research, and am on a mission to make powerful scientific data, visualization and communication tools accessible through the web. Curvenote is part of my mission to reimagine collective knowledge creation for modern science.

founders.name: Steve Purves, Founder
founders.description: An engineer with 20+ years industry experience building software for scientists and engineers. Deep technical expertise in computer vision, data science and machine learning. Led product development and R&D teams and managed multi-year R&D projects with Oil & Gas majors. In 2013, he founded a consultancy and leading distributed technical teams in both startups and enterprise in energy, healthcare, finance and electronic manufacturing. Founding member of an open geoscience society.

# **Scientific content.Without compromise.**
Say goodbye to static scientific publishing. Curvenote redefines how researchers, teams and institutes create, share, and communicate their science.
[Request a Demo](https://curvenote.com/</demo>)
## **Elevate Your Research with Web-First Publishing**
Craft scientific articles that engage readers through a familiar, web-first experience that brings science and data to the surface with interactivity for more context. Curvenote enhances comprehension and maximizes the impact and reach of your research.
Various examples of content from the Curvenote ecosystem, including [**AGU Showcase**](https://curvenote.com/<https:/agu.curve.space/>), [**SciPy Proceedings**](https://curvenote.com/<https:/proceedings.scipy.org/>), [**Applied Geophysics**](https://curvenote.com/<https:/appliedgeophysics.org/>), [**Elemental Microscopy**](https://curvenote.com/<https:/elementalmicroscopy.com/>), [**Physiome**](https://curvenote.com/<https:/journal.physiomeproject.org/>), [**Agrogeo 2024, Conference Abstracts**](https://curvenote.com/<https:/agrogeo24.curve.space/>). All content shown is CC-BY-4.0.
## Our Solutions
Help a breadth of teams, communities and institutes communicate their research on any scale.
###### Journals
###### Curvenote platform and infrastructure make submission and publications streamlined from start to finish.
###### Research Institutes
###### Accelerate scientific discovery with our research integrity checks and modern sharing features and tools.
###### Conferences
###### Create rich conference proceedings and abstracts that support computational notebooks.
###### Private Consortiums
###### Provide your consortium with the on-demand computational tools they need to get the most out of your research deliverables.
###### Universities
###### Share a library of reproducible research that is aligned with modern scholarly needs using Curvenote platform.
###### Lab Groups
###### Take control of how you share your research online, sharing computational, reproducible work in a modern way.
## **Keep Your Data Close & Metadata Rich**
Integrate datasets and create rich, informative science for a web-based delivery. Curvenote captures rich metadata, elevating the reading experience and aligning with industry-leading practices. Take advantage of enhanced discoverability, citation, and integration with other platforms, ensuring your work is not starved of its network of data. [Learn more](https://curvenote.com/</features>)
Deep dive links in a research article, see [**demo**](https://curvenote.com/<https:/agu.curve.space/articles/NN0001>). (CC-BY-4.0)
The Curvenote Editor is a WYSIWYG authoring experience showing content from “The Clp1 R140H mutation alters tRNA metabolism and mRNA 3′ processing in mouse models of pontocerebellar hypoplasia” [Monaghan _et al._ , 2021, CC-BY-4.0](https://curvenote.com/<https:/doi.org/10.1073/pnas.2110730118>).
## **Collaborate, Innovate, Share**
Streamline your workflow with Curvenote's intuitive interface. Write in Markdown, embed interactive figures, data visualizations, and generate real-time previews—all in one seamless environment. Whether you’re crafting a report, developing a research paper, or collaborating on a project, Curvenote empowers your creativity.[Learn more](https://curvenote.com/</features>)
## **Hosting. Someones gotta do it**
As a flexible cloud-based solution, we allow you to get started quickly with a Curvenote hosted environment. Keep your team doing research—let us handle the infrastructure and give you fast, cutting edge, global hosting. Need a self-hosted solution? We work with your team to implement the Curvenote Platform your way. Discuss white label brand and design options with our team.
![Curvenote hosting options](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/60ff0a25e3004400049dc542/6747aabb2fe696bbacdb5c4c_Hosting-graphic.png)
## **Join the Future**
Experience a platform designed for the modern science creator. Try Curvenote today and unleash your potential book a demo.
[**Request Demo**](https://curvenote.com/</demo>)

Curvenote is a SaaS company redefining how scientists and engineers communicate and publish their work. Founded in 2019 and hailing from Calgary, Canada, Curvenote is a member of Y Combinator’s Winter 2021 batch and currently consists of a compact team of three.

Its mission is rooted in transforming scientific publishing from static formats to dynamic, interactive platforms. Imagine scientific reports filled with live data graphs, engaging readers more effectively and making replication of studies a breeze—that’s the future Curvenote is building toward.

The platform offers a suite of tools designed to enhance the readability and interactivity of scientific content. Researchers can craft articles that prioritize web-first experiences, making it easier to digest complex data. Essentially, it's about bringing science into a modern context where engagement and reproducibility are vastly improved.

Curvenote supports a range of users—from individual researchers to large universities and research institutes—by streamlining the publishing process, integrating rich datasets, and enriching documents with metadata to improve discoverability. Their offerings don't stop there: they also enable collaborative reporting, tool integration, and even flexible hosting options tailored to teams that vary in scale.

Some of Curvenote’s current initiatives include partnerships with organizations like the American Geophysical Union and the Microscopy Society of America. These collaborations are aimed at embedding computational notebooks into traditional publishing workflows, which is a game-changer for producing rich, reproducible research.

Curvenote's vision clearly acknowledges a simple truth: science deserves better than a PDF. By embracing this ethos, they aim to elevate the entire experience of research publication, ensuring that insights are shared, understood, and built upon effectively. 

If you’re curious about what Curvenote offers or want a firsthand experience, you can check out their website at [curvenote.com](https://curvenote.com). More than just a tool, Curvenote represents a shift toward more integrated, interactive, and ultimately impactful scientific communication.
